result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 11/1/22 filed by the Defendant requesting a sooner court date than 11/21/22.

**Matter is already set for a sooner date, 11/9/22, to address bail.**
Bail/bond hearing on November 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. Rypel.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form - defendant requesting a bail reduction or bailee status. **Reviewed  by Judge Reilly - Denied**
Hearing on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:01 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Torrence V Sheppard in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Torrence V Sheppard.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes the matter is before the Court on Defense Motion to Modify Bail.  Atty. Rypel presents arguments; he is asking for a lower cash bail or signature bond.  State objects and presents arguments. For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny Defense Motion to Modify Bail; bail to remain as previously set.  Court inquires as to the status of the case.  Atty. Rypel provides an update; he is requesting another further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  Court believes the matter should be set for trial and wonders why he needs more time for status.  Atty. Rypel advises he just received discovery and needs time to discuss the matter with his client.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings in about 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 10/12/22 re: defendant is making a motion for bail reduction.  **Reviewed by the Court - Matter is already set for a Bail hearing 10/19 to address motion filed by counsel.**
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: September 30, 2022 Preliminary Hearing
Bail/bond hearing on October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:39 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Torrence V Sheppard in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Torrence V Sheppard.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes defense filed a motion to modify bail.  Atty. Rypel presents arguments and is asking that the bail be amended to a signature bond.  State intejects and notes that they were not able to comply with victim notification rights to proceed on the motion to modify bail today and requests it be set over to another date.  Atty. Rypel objects and presents statements.  Court will adjourn for a bail motion hearing next week.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. Rypel.
Filed by Atty. Rypel.
Hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:58 AM Defendant Torrence V Sheppard in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Torrence V Sheppard.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
City of Waukesha police officer Nathan Schmidt sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Sitzberger.  Cross examination by Atty. Rypel.  State rests.  Testimony close.  Atty. Sitzberger moves for bind over.  Atty. Rypel moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Atty Stephen Rypel
Atty Stephen Rypel
Preliminary hearing on September 30, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:50 PM Defendant Torrence V Sheppard in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula.  
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Todd K. Martens.

Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-16-2022)

Hearing on September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

2:39 PM Defendant Torrence V Sheppard in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel to allow for the defendant to be evaluated by the Public Defender's Office. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
